title: 107_s1134
content: The Act may be cited as the "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" and includes modifications applicable to qualified small business stock. The "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" includes amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. These amendments involve the repeal of minimum tax preference and an increase in the rollover period for qualified small business stock from 60 days to 180 days. The Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to extend the rollover period for qualified small business stock from 60 days to 180 days. Additionally, the holding period for partial exclusion for gains from certain small business stock is reduced from 5 years to 3 years. The Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to reduce the holding period for partial exclusion for gains from certain small business stock from 5 years to 3 years. Additionally, the per-issuer limitation on taxpayer's eligible gain is repealed, and modifications are made to the qualified trade or business criteria. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to extend the working capital limitation from 2 years to 5 years and repeal the last sentence. Additionally, an exception is added to the redemption rules for certain stock purchases by corporations with a business purpose. Section 1202(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to allow a corporation to disregard a stock purchase for tax purposes if it can prove a business purpose for the purchase. This amendment aims to prevent corporations from using stock purchases to avoid tax limitations. Additionally, there is an increase in the exclusion under section 1202. The exclusion for gain from certain small business stock is increased from 50 percent to 100 percent under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Conforming amendments are made to related sections of the Code. Section 1(h) of the Internal Revenue Code is amended by removing paragraph (8) and redesignating paragraphs (9) to (12) as paragraphs (8) to (11) respectively. Additionally, paragraph (9) is amended to remove specific references and simplify the language. The heading for section 1202 is also affected by these changes. The heading for section 1202 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to replace "partial" with "100-percent". Additionally, the table of sections for part I of subchapter P of chapter 1 is updated to reflect this change. The heading for section 1202 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to replace "partial" with "100-percent". Subsection (a) of section 1202 is amended to allow corporations to qualify for partial exclusion for gains from certain small business stock. Subsection (c) is amended to specify that stock held among members of a controlled group is not eligible for the exclusion. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to increase the asset limitation for qualified small businesses from $50,000,000 to $300,000,000. Additionally, stock held by a group member is not eligible for exclusion. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to increase the asset limitation for qualified small businesses to $300,000,000, with an inflation adjustment provision for stock issued after 2002. The amendments made by this section apply to stock issued after the date of the enactment of this Act, with adjustments for rounding to the nearest multiple of $10,000.
